description: For a long time, the officer-turned-general was seen as a mere victim. Yet recent works have offered a new reading of this historic figure. Aline Girard, Pierre Ouzoulias and Jean-Pierre Sakoun make the case for Dreyfus to enter the Panthéon.

headline: From Peru to the Vatican, the rise of 'Monseñor Roberto de Chiclayo,' now Leo XIV
description: Francis's successor at the Vatican lived for many years in the South American country. Le Monde traveled to the city of Chiclayo to meet with several people who remember the days when he was still known as Robert Prevost.

headline: Patrick Artus: 'In the US, attacks on the public research system and universities compromise growth prospects'
description: More than the erratic policies on tariffs and inflation, it is the Trump administration's ideological attacks that pose a long-term threat to US power, argues the economist Patrick Artus in his column.

description: Despite Iran's internet blackouts, Tehran residents have shared their fears and anger at the Israeli strikes, both on social media platforms and with Le Monde.

headline: Beyoncé brings Texas flair to Paris
description: The American superstar performed the first of three concerts at the arena in Saint-Denis on Thursday. The show centered on tracks from her latest album, Cowboy Carter.

headline: How Trump broke with his strategic allies to side with Russia over Ukraine
description: 'The Transatlantic Divorce' (5/5). After Barack Obama stepped back during the 2014 annexation of Crimea and Joe Biden hesitated, Donald Trump, now back in the White House, aligned himself with Russia at the UN and left his strategic allies alone to face Vladimir Putin.
